content: This app itself is awesome! Well done Devs. I would give it 4 or 5 for the execution.... Unfortunately; I have only ever found someone to play online on one occasion so there are obviously not many people playing... Takes it down to 3 starts for this reason alone.
Decent port of the original cats game. The AI is kind of dumb and the card distribution doesn't feel truly random.
Please get the premium edition on here aswell!

Boring. Not enough people to play with. Maybe if you didnt charge 4 bucks to install maybe more people would. I've downloaded way better board game apps for like 99 cents. I love love letter but this is a RIP off. Shame on whoever did this
Great game made even better by letting you play private matches with friends and family during a quarantine!
Old art, only basic cards. Slow gameplay & AI has 1 setting. Very few people online for live play. No stats recorded or game log to see what other players did on their turn.

I've played hundreds of in person rounds of this game, and love the physical version. There aren't enough players online to successfully matchmake in this game, and the AI is good enough, but makes some really dumb mistakes that a human would never make. For example: they will play the King to give me the Princess, then on their following turn: play the Baron with a Countess. Major facepalm. Fun for a while until you notice some really poor plays, and now I'm hesitant to pick it back up.
Had alot of fun. Enough customization and the premise is simple enough. Sometimes there is luck involved, but without a doubt skill helps tilt the odds in your favor.
Fun game except that it is single player only. I hoped i could play with those next to me and avoid having to carry a deck.
Buggy. Seems about 25% of the time Guard/guess is wrong I'm still eliminated.
Not bad. Not great. Needs a pass and play option

Nice looking implementation, but as others have said, the AI needs a lot of work. Multiple AI players often gang up on the human player, even when another AI player is close to winning the overall game.
Can't play multiplayer on public server.
Really fun to play on car ridesüòÑ
Good but the Baron is broken he should lose to Prince and Handmaid but seems to beat them. It's a bad bug and negatively affects gameplay.
Great game. Great recreation of the card version
This is a great port of the card game!

love letter is an extremely fun game but thjs app is not up to par with the quality of the game. The ai is not very good at making rhe best strategic decisions to win. This would be fine if the player base was existant wich would allow you to play with others online
Overall liked it, the ai seems random at times, but still fun to play.
Good game. Plays smoothly and is fun. would score higher if you could add bots to empty spaces in multiplayer.

App needs achievements. User preference to immediately skip to next round if you lose current round in local play with all AI. AI needs change. So often I have 0 hearts and the AI focus on me the whole game instead of going after each other. They also more often than not guess properly with the guard in the first 2 turns. It's pretty stupid.
Descent digital version, but the game is way too much about luck
i dont play this online, i like it for vs ai. its not perfect, sometimes the ai seems random, sometime it feels rigged, but i do find the game fun for an every now and then game to pass the time.
Why are all of the AI players' names male?
replyContent:
Hi Megan Knight,
Obviously, at Asmodee Digital, nobody is against the fact that a woman can send a love letter to the princess of Tempest ‚ù§Ô∏è Unfortunately those AI players' names must conform to the original physical cards game and also be in accordance with the time in which the game univers fits. Note that we'll forward this feedback ü§ó Thank you

content: I love this game but when I played a single game, the computer guessed I had the princess but I had a different card and it knocked me off the round. very frustrating
replyContent:

content: Glad to see others have noticed that the AI guesses my card every time.
Great game but it shouldn't charge us when there are only one or 2 people online at once. I paid to play against bad computers!

At the moment, this app freezes/crashes my phone (Doogee S60). Hopefully I can increase my star rating once it has been fixed because it is an enjoyable gard game and I hope the app game will be the same.
replyContent:
Hi, we are very sorry for the issues you're encountering with Love Letter. For any bug reports, please contact support at this address:  https://asmodee.helpshift.com/a/love-letter/?fbclid=IwAR1Q_44ZAO-xaqnfbBP1v2a11KUUNX8Gqnu85BzySMZIoQCD2VpB_DBsEn4&p=android

content: I love this game although I usually don't like card games. It's beautiful, perfectly polished and really fun.
kept freezing on intro screen and phone had to be hard reset each time

As others have mentioned, AI is horrendous. For instance: - AI seems to guess my card correctly 8 out of 10 times with Guard, even on the first hand - AI will attack randomly, not the person who is one heart away from winning. I was attacked by all 3 opponents once when I was in last place with 0 of 4 hearts and one opponent had 3 of 4 hearts - AI guesses incorrectly with Guard when they shouldn't. Somone beat me with Barron. They had the Princess, I had Countess. AI uses Guard; picks Priest.ü§®

Regret buying this. I've enjoyed other games from this company, but this one is buggy and boring. Ive found that the baron often dosen't seem to give the correct result, and sometimes even if the gaurd guesses correctly, it still says its wrong. (I'll have the card the AI guesses and sometimes it still registers as incorrect.) The AI seems pretty random too at times.
Guessing correctly on the opening hand 3 to 4 times in a row in 5 different games...sort your AI out guys, otherwise a great conversion online play is top notch.
The bot just discarded their princess when their other card was a prince. Not very smart AI! They will also guess if you have a card when there is only one and it's it their own hand.
Game is an awesome version of the actual card game. Wished more people had it to play with online.

The adaptation is fine, however it needs some teaks to make it shine. In multiplayer, it is rather cumbersome to set up a game with friends, relying on temporary codes. It also does not allow to add bots to fill the lobby. After a few additions and tweaks it can be a 5/5
